definition:
A &%Substance that is virtuall incompressible.
It is intended to be used in its &%Liquid state.  It can be thought of as a liquid gear,
creating a mechanical advantage in a hydraulic system.  Small amounts of fluid can be
easily and rapidly added to a chamber that actuates a piston which can generate great force.

positive_examples: This is an example of hydraulic fluid.
The hydraulic fluid demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed hydraulic fluid in this context.
A typical case of hydraulic fluid would involve these features.
The concept of hydraulic fluid applies here.
A specialized lubricant that transmits power in hydraulic machinery and systems while providing lubrication.
negative_examples: This is an example of grease, not hydraulic fluid.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Grease, or other types of Lubricant
